description: Display of 2no. internally illuminated fascia signs and 6no. non-illuminated fascia signs
decision_conditions: The fee required for your planning application is £ 103.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002. You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk

No advertisement to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to -(a)	endanger persons using any highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);(b)	obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or(c)	hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
Erection of two storey rear extension (including basement extension) and demolition of part roof and erection of roof extension(TBC)

The intensity of the illumination of the internally illuminated fascia signs hereby permitted shall be no greater than 500 cd/m.Reason 1: To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Reason 2: Reason:  In the interests of amenity, the free flow of traffic on the highway and road safety in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The internally illuminated fascia signs hereby permitted shall be switched off no later than 10.00pm on Mondays to Saturdays and 5.30pm on Sundays and not switched on again until 7.30am Mondays to Saturdays and 11.00am on Sundays.Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
Please confirm description of proposed works "Erection of two storey rear extension (including basement extension) and demolition of part roof and erection of roof extension(TBC)"

Under the Town and Country Planning (Fees for Applications, Deemed Applications, Requests and Site Visits) (England) Regulations 2012 a 'free go' is only applicable If the proposal is the first revision of an application for development of the same character or description on the same site by the same applicant within 12 months of making the earlier application if withdrawn or the date of decision if granted or refused (including signs only if withdrawn or refused) and NOT a duplicate application made by the same applicant within 28 days.(f)that no application made by or on behalf of the applicant in relation to the whole or any part of the site has already been exempted from regulation 3 by this regulation. Therefore please note that there is a fee payable for this application of £641.00

Please confirm description of proposed works as "Variation of Condition 2 (Plans) of Planning Application 17/16652/FUL (Allowed on Appeal) and 18/16556/FUL (Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Plans) of planning permission 17/16652/FUL - Erection of two storey side and single storey rear extensions. Conversion of single dwelling into 2 x 2 bedroom dwellings) to increase projection of single storey rear extension."
Please provide all corresponding plans/elevations approved under the previous planning permission. These should be clearly marked as 'Approved' or be otherwise clearly identifiable.

The fee required for your planning application is £116.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002. You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk

The submitted form states the second Condition to be discharged as Condition 14. This is incorrectly numbered. Please amend the planning statement to reflect the correct Condition as per original Decision Notice.

Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy BE17 (Signs and Advertisements) of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Unitary Development Plan First Alternation.

Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No advertisement to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.Reason: To comply with Regulation 14 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) regulations, 2007 in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development approved by this planning permission will be liable to pay Mayoral and local Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) charges.  Payment will be due once the owner/developer serves a development Commencement Notice on the Council, and a payment Demand Notice has been received by the owner.  Failure to submit a Commencement Notice will incur a surcharge of 20% of the chargeable amount or £2,500, whichever is the lower amount.   When you have discharged all pre-commencement conditions the Council will issue a Liability Notice to the owner setting out the CIL calculations.  Accompanying the Liability Notice will be a  blank Commencement Notice and if necessary a blank Assumption of Liability form, both of which need to be completed and returned to the Council prior to development commencing.  A failure to do so will incur a surcharge.  Should you have any questions in respect of the contents of this letter or the CIL more generally, please contact the Council's Contact Centre by email cil@kingston.gov.uk or phone 0208 547 5002.
The plans formally considered alongside the application are as follows:1908/01Ground Floor PlanLower Ham Road Street Scene1908/03 Rev A1908/02 Rev A

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Reasonable efforts have been made to check that the plans submitted for the purposes of this planning application are consistent from one to the next, and that the development hereby approved can be implemented in accordance with all of the plans submitted. Should it transpire that this is not possible and that your plans are flawed, please be clear that it may be impossible to implement this permission, and that any development undertaken which relies on this permission may be unauthorised and subject to enforcement action.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Unless clearly specified otherwise, the base of the development shown on the approved plans is taken to be external ground level, and not a Damp Proof Course or Internal Finished Floor Level. The external ground level is expected to remain consistent before and after construction of the approved development unless specified otherwise on the approved plans.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Application is for the reduction and reshape of a small self seeded Ash tree to the rear of the property in a very small garden space where the growth of the tree is causing damage to the property.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The application is for the removal of two small trees to the rear of the property which are not visible to the public and therefore not affecting public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:As the trees are to the rear of the property they are not affecting to public amenity. Largely the works are also acceptable and appropriate in continued maintenance.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works would normally be considered excessive and would not be permissable, however, I have been to this site on a a number of occasions over the past 10 years and this line of Lime trees has allways caused me concern due to evident cavities and central decay within them. Unfortunately this is not unusual for the species and in this instance given the stuructural problems of the trees I believe permission should be granted to reduce them significantly and in time potentially allow their removal depending on how they respond to  the pollarding.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The chief works are to the mature Cedar at the rear of the property. These works are repeat maintenance and are both appropriate and therefore acceptable in nature. The other works are minor and are just to reduce the smaller trees to the sides of the rear property boundary. These too are acceptable.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The Pine is a very large specimen and as seen in the photos is clearly dead and needing removal on health and safety grounds.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works are necessary to prevent damage to the building and to ensure safety to the users of the facilities. These are not harmful alterations to the tree, 3m is a very small amount off of the tree given it's size.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works are all appropriate general and repeat management to trees being maintained in a back garden setting.Recommendation:Approve.
Satisfactory structural design of the extended pool side and satisfactory resolution of our structural engineers requests (A1)
Any Fire Safety Consultation queries being confirmed and accepted prior to completion of that stage on site.
Submitted structural engineers design calculations/details for elements of structure/alterations to existing structure & their supports to be checked and accepted.
Specialist details of glazed guarding to juliette balcony to be provided to demonstrate compliance with K2/K4 & BS 6180.
Specialist details of structural glass & box gutter to be provided.
Subject to any imposed local conditions by the Inspecting Authority.
Provide a structural design for the proposed project. (A1)
Provide supporting structural calculations (A1)
